frame.name: Having_or_lacking_access
frame.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Theme</fen> has access to a <fen>Useful_location</fen> or is blocked from it by a <fen>Barrier</fen>. <ex></ex> <ex>Making <fex name="loc">services</fex> <t>accessible</t> <fex name="Ent">to those with special needs</fex> is expensive.</ex> <ex><fex name="Theme">I</fex> don't have <t>access</t> <fex name="loc">to the safe</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Barrier">The regime</fex> has now restricted <t>access</t> <fex name="loc">to the internet</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Theme
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Theme</fen> whose motion is blocked or free.
</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Theme</fen> exceeds or falls short of the ability to move to the <fen>Useful_location</fen>
<ex>He has <fex name="Degree">full</fex> <t>access</t> to the facilities.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Circumstances</fen> under which the <fen>Theme</fen> meets or fails to meet the pre-conditions for getting to the <fen>Useful_location</fen>.
</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Explanation</fen> for why the <fen>Barrier</fen> exists, or for why the <fen>Theme</fen> meets or fails to meet pre-conditions for entering the <fen>Useful_location</fen>.
</def-root>

FE.name: Useful_location
FE.definition: <def-root>The place or thing that the <fen>Theme</fen> is headed towards, despite a potential or actual <fen>Barrier</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Barrier
FE.definition: <def-root>An entity, event, or state that (at least potentially) prevents the <fen>Theme</fen> from getting to the <fen>Useful_location</fen>. </def-root>
